story.kicker_image_caption: Graeme Cremer with his Zimbabwe teammates. (AP File Photo)
story.storykicker: 29-year-old leg-break bowler Graeme Cremer returned after an injury layoff to lead Zimbabwe in the upcoming ODI and T20I series against India.
story.storybody:
After sacking Hamilton Masakadza as captain, Zimbabwe named leg-break bowler Graeme Cremer to lead their side against India in the upcoming one-day international and T20I series.

29-year-old Cremer, who missed the 2016 World T20 with injury, returned and will lead both squads of 18 men each.

Though he was sacked as captain, Hamilton Masakadza retained his place in both sides.

In addition to Cremer's legspin, Zimbabwe have left-arm spinners Wellington Masakzadza and Tendai Chisoro and another legspinner Timken Maruma as slow bowling options. Tendai Charata, Donald Tiripano and Neville Madziva will be the seamers.

Elton Chigumbura, Sikandar Raza, Sean Williams and Craig Ervine will form the top and middle order.

Medium pacer Tinashe Panyangara has been ruled out the series. The 30-year-old Panyangara will not be part of the three ODIs and three T20Is owing to a back injury.

Taurai Muzarabani, who has played six ODIs and seven T20Is, was picked in Panyangara's place.

The ODIs will be played from June 11 to 15 and the T20s will be played from June 18 to 22. All six matches will be played in Harare.

Squads

ODI: Graeme Cremer (capt), Richmond Mutumbami (wk), Taurai Muzarabani, Chamu Chibhabha, Peter Moor, Elton Chigumbura, Vusi Sibanda, Tawanda Mupariwa, Sean Williams, Sikandar Raza, Neville Madziva, Donald Tiripano, Timycen Maruma, Wellington Masakadza, Tendai Chisoro, Hamilton Masakadza, Tendai Chatara, Craig Ervine

T20I: Graeme Cremer (capt), Richmond Mutumbami (wk), Taurai Muzarabani, Brian Chari, Peter Moor, Elton Chigumbura, Vusi Sibanda, Luke Jongwe, Sean Williams, Sikandar Raza, Neville Madziva, Donald Tiripano, Timycen Maruma, Wellington Masakadza, Tendai Chisoro, Hamilton Masakadza, Tendai Chatara, Malcolm Waller.
